ComAwareEventInfo Class

Definition

Permits late-bound registration of an event handler.

In this Article

[System.Security.SecuritySafeCritical]
public class ComAwareEventInfo : System.Reflection.EventInfo
Inheritance
Object

Remarks

Normally, compilers will automatically embed calls to the System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComAwareEventInfo.AddEventHandler(Object,Delegate) and System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComAwareEventInfo.RemoveEventHandler(Object,Delegate) methods instead of using regular add handler and remove handler methods for events. This occurs if the interface that the corresponding event is defined on needs to be embedded.

You can specify this by embedding the entire assembly that contains the interface by using the /link option on the compilers or by setting the Embed Interop Types property to True in Visual Studio.

The ComAwareEventInfo type derives from the EventInfo class and overrides the System.Reflection.EventInfo.AddEventHandler(Object,Delegate) and System.Reflection.EventInfo.RemoveEventHandler(Object,Delegate) methods.

Constructors

ComAwareEventInfo(Type,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ComAwareEventInfo class by using the specified type and a name of the event on the type.

public ComAwareEventInfo (Type type, string eventName);
type
Type

The type of object.

eventName
String

The name of an event on type.

Properties

Attributes

Gets the attributes for this event.

public override System.Reflection.EventAttributes Attributes { get; }
Value
EventAttributes

The read-only attributes for this event.

Remarks

The attributes are returned in a 4-byte integer, which represents a bitmap of the attributes set for the event that is reflected by this instance.

DeclaringType

Gets the class that declares this member.

public override Type DeclaringType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type object for the class that declares this member.

Name

Gets the name of the current member.

public override string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of this member.

ReflectedType

Gets the class object that was used to initialize this instance.

public override Type ReflectedType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type object that was used to initialize the current object.

Methods

AddEventHandler(Object,Delegate)

Attaches an event handler to a COM object.

public override void AddEventHandler (object target, Delegate handler);
target
Object

The target object that the event delegate should bind to.

handler
Delegate

The event delegate.

Remarks

This method is similar to the System.Reflection.EventInfo.AddEventHandler(Object,Delegate) method except that it allows you to attach events to COM objects.

If target is a COM object, this method adds a delegate to an event by using the System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Combine(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate) method.

AddEventHandler facilitates registering COM event sinks that forward calls to corresponding managed delegates. It requires the following information:

  • The target object itself (target).

  • The GUID of the source interface.

  • The DispID of the method on the COM interface that corresponds to the specified event.

  • The delegate that would be invoked when the COM object triggers the corresponding event (handler).

    AddEventHandler looks up the corresponding COM source interface (specified as the first parameter of the System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventInterfaceAttribute.ComEventInterfaceAttribute(Type,Type) constructor). It then looks up a method on the source interface whose name is identical to the event name. The value of GuidAttribute on the source interface is the GUID that is passed to System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Combine(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate); the value of DispIDAttribute on the method is the DispID value that is passed to System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Combine(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate).

GetAddMethod(Boolean)

Gets the method that was used to add an event handler delegate to the event source.

public override System.Reflection.MethodInfo GetAddMethod (bool nonPublic);
nonPublic
Boolean

true to return non-public methods; otherwise, false.

Returns
MethodInfo

The method that was used to add an event handler delegate to the event source.

Exceptions
MethodAccessException

nonPublic is true and the method used to add an event handler delegate is non-public, but the caller does not have permission to reflect on non-public methods.

Remarks

This method calls the GetAddMethod method.

GetCustomAttributes(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, gets an array that contains all the custom attributes that are applied to this member.

public override object[] GetCustomAttributes (bool inherit);
inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Object[]

An array that contains all the custom attributes, or an array that has no elements if no attributes were defined.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

This member belongs to a type that is loaded into the reflection-only context. See How to: Load Assemblies into the Reflection-Only Context.

TypeLoadException

A custom attribute type cannot be loaded.

Remarks

This method calls the GetCustomAttributes method of the underlying EventInfo object.

GetCustomAttributes(Type,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, gets an array that contains all the custom attributes of the specified type that are applied to this member.

public override object[] GetCustomAttributes (Type attributeType, bool inherit);
attributeType
Type

The attribute type to search for. Only attributes that are assignable to this type can be returned.

inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Object[]

An array that contains all the custom attributes of the specified type, or an array that has no elements if no attributes were defined.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

attributeType is null.

InvalidOperationException

This member belongs to a type that is loaded into the reflection-only context. See How to: Load Assemblies into the Reflection-Only Context

TypeLoadException

A custom attribute type cannot be loaded.

GetRaiseMethod(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, returns the method that was called when the event was raised.

public override System.Reflection.MethodInfo GetRaiseMethod (bool nonPublic);
nonPublic
Boolean

true to return non-public methods; otherwise, false.

Returns
MethodInfo

The object that was called when the event was raised.

Exceptions
MethodAccessException

nonPublic is true and the method used to add an event handler delegate is non-public, but the caller does not have permission to reflect on non-public methods.

Remarks

This method returns null for events that are declared with the C# event keyword or the Visual Basic Event keyword. This is because the C# and Visual Basic compilers do not generate such a method.

GetRemoveMethod(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, retrieves the MethodInfo object for removing a method of the event.

public override System.Reflection.MethodInfo GetRemoveMethod (bool nonPublic);
nonPublic
Boolean

true to return non-public methods; otherwise, false.

Returns
MethodInfo

The method that was used to remove an event handler delegate from the event source.

Exceptions
MethodAccessException

nonPublic is true and the method used to add an event handler delegate is non-public, but the caller does not have permission to reflect on non-public methods.

IsDefined(Type,Boolean)

Indicates whether one or more instances of the specified attribute are applied to this member.

public override bool IsDefined (Type attributeType, bool inherit);
attributeType
Type

The attribute type to search for.

inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified attribute has been applied to this member; otherwise, false.

RemoveEventHandler(Object,Delegate)

Detaches an event handler from a COM object.

public override void RemoveEventHandler (object target, Delegate handler);
target
Object

The target object that the event delegate is bound to.

handler
Delegate

The event delegate.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The event does not have a public remove accessor.

ArgumentException

The handler that was passed in cannot be used.

TargetException

In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch Exception instead.

The target parameter is null and the event is not static.

-or-

The EventInfo is not declared on the target.

MethodAccessException

In the .NET for Windows Store apps or the Portable Class Library, catch the base class exception, MemberAccessException, instead.

The caller does not have access permission to the member.

Remarks

This method is similar to the System.Reflection.EventInfo.RemoveEventHandler(Object,Delegate) method, except that it allows you to detach events from COM objects.

If target is a COM object, this method releases a delegate to an event by using the System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Remove(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate) method.

RemoveEventHandler facilitates unregistering COM event sinks that forward calls to corresponding managed delegates. It requires the following information:

  • The target object itself (target).

  • The GUID of the source interface.

  • The DispID of the method on the COM interface that corresponds to the specified event.

  • The delegate that would be invoked when the COM object triggers the corresponding event (handler).

    RemoveEventHandler looks up the corresponding COM source interface (specified as the first parameter of the System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventInterfaceAttribute.ComEventInterfaceAttribute(Type,Type) constructor). It then it looks up a method on the source interface whose name is identical to the event name. The value of GuidAttribute on the source interface is the GUID that is passed to System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Remove(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate); the value of DispIDAttribute on the method is the DispID value that is passed to System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComEventsHelper.Remove(Object,Guid,Int32,Delegate).
